failedToRelocateDataFolderDesc: Failed to relocate data folder. Please try again.
factoryResetDesc: This will reset all app settings to their defaults. This can't be undone. We only recommend this if the app is corrupted.
documentationDesc: Browse MOBIUS documentation with searchable index.

discordDesc: Join our community for support and discussions.
reportAnIssueDesc: Found a bug? Help us out by filing an issue on GitHub.

creditsDesc2: Special thanks to our open-source dependencies—especially llama.cpp and Tauri—and to our amazing AI community.

dataFolder.appDataDesc: Default location for messages and other user data.
dataFolder.appLogsDesc: View detailed logs of the App.

others.spellCheckDesc: Enable spell check for your threads.
others.resetFactoryDesc: Restore application to its initial state, erasing all models and chat history. This action is irreversible and recommended only if the application is corrupted.

appearance.title: Appearance
appearance.windowBackgroundDesc: Set the app window's background color.
appearance.appMainViewDesc: Set the main content area's background color.
appearance.primaryDesc: Set the primary color for UI components.
appearance.accentDesc: Set the accent color for UI highlights.
appearance.destructiveDesc: Set the color for destructive actions.
appearance.resetToDefaultDesc: Reset all appearance settings to default.
appearance.resetAppearanceSuccessDesc: All appearance settings have been restored to default.
appearance.chatWidthDesc: Customize the width of the chat view.
appearance.showLineNumbersDesc: Display line numbers in code blocks.
appearance.resetCodeBlockStyleDesc: Reset code block style to default.
appearance.resetCodeBlockSuccessDesc: Code block style has been restored to default.

hardware.name: Name
hardware.enableVulkanDesc: Use Vulkan API for GPU acceleration. Do not enable Vulkan if you have an NVIDIA GPU as it may cause compatibility issues.
hardware.calibrationDesc: Analyze your hardware to determine optimal model sizes and settings.
hardware.benchmarkDesc: Run actual inference to measure real performance.
hardware.loadModelFirst: Load a model to benchmark your hardware.
hardware.alreadyOptimal: Your settings are already optimal for your hardware.
hardware.modelWillRestart: Model will restart with optimized settings.
hardware.calibrationApplied: Calibration settings applied. Model will restart.
hardware.tipTierEntry: Basic hardware — can run small, fast AI models. Great for getting started.
hardware.tipTierStandard: Solid hardware — handles mainstream 7B-parameter models well.
hardware.tipTierPerformance: Strong hardware — can run larger models with full GPU acceleration and extended conversations.
hardware.tipTierUltra: Top-tier hardware — supports the largest local models with maximum context and speed.
hardware.tipModelSize: Parameters measure model complexity. 7B = 7 billion learned values. Larger models are more capable but need more memory.
hardware.tipQuantization: Compression format that reduces memory usage. Q4 = 4-bit (smaller, faster). Q8 = 8-bit (higher quality). K_M = balanced precision.
hardware.tipMaxContext: How much text the AI can 'remember' in one conversation. Roughly 750 words per 1,000 tokens. More context = longer conversations but uses more memory.
hardware.tipGpuAcceleration: How much of the AI model runs on your graphics card vs CPU. GPU is dramatically faster — full offload means maximum speed.
hardware.tipAvx2: Advanced CPU instructions that speed up math operations used by AI models.
hardware.tipFlashAttn: A faster method for processing conversation context. Available with 4GB+ GPU memory.
hardware.tipLargeContext: Ability to use 16K+ token context windows for longer, more detailed conversations.
hardware.tipMultiGpu: Multiple graphics cards can split a model across them, enabling larger models.
hardware.tipVulkan: Alternative GPU API to CUDA. Useful for AMD GPUs or when CUDA isn't available.
hardware.tipCudaStatus: CUDA enables GPU-accelerated AI inference. llama.cpp requires compute capability 5.0 or higher.
hardware.tipCudaDriver: Your NVIDIA driver version. Newer drivers support newer CUDA features.
hardware.tipComputeCap: Your GPU's compute capability determines which CUDA features it supports. 5.0+ is required for llama.cpp, 7.0+ enables tensor cores.
hardware.performanceModeDesc: System-level optimizations for maximum inference speed. Each setting has a risk indicator — read the warnings before enabling.
hardware.riskModerateDesc: Meaningful tradeoff. Increases power draw and temperatures. Fully reversible.
hardware.perfKvCacheDesc: Compress the attention cache to free GPU memory. Uses Q8 for keys (minimal loss) and Q4 for values (more compression). Frees enough VRAM to offload 5-10 additional model layers to GPU.
hardware.perfKvCacheWarn: May produce slightly different outputs compared to full-precision cache. Most users won't notice the difference. The quality impact is much smaller than model quantization itself.
hardware.perfCachePromptDesc: Reuse the attention cache across messages in the same conversation. Dramatically reduces wait time for follow-up messages since the model doesn't re-process the entire conversation history.
hardware.perfCachePromptWarn: No quality impact. Uses additional memory to store the cache between turns.
hardware.perfGpuClockDesc: Lock your GPU to its maximum boost clock speed, preventing thermal throttle-downs during sustained inference. Can prevent 10-20% speed dips during long generations.
hardware.perfGpuClockWarn: Increases GPU power consumption and fan noise. GPU temperature will rise. The lock is removed when MOBIUS closes or the system reboots. Monitor temperatures if your cooling is limited.
hardware.perfPowerPlanDesc: Your current Windows power plan. 'High Performance' or 'Ultimate Performance' prevents CPU frequency scaling during inference, maintaining consistent speed.
hardware.perfPowerPlanWarn: Cannot be changed from MOBIUS — open Windows Settings > Power & battery to switch. 'Balanced' mode may throttle CPU during inference.
hardware.perfApplied: Performance setting applied. Model will restart.
hardware.perfRemoved: Performance setting removed. Model will restart.

httpsProxy.proxyUrlDesc: The URL and port of your proxy server.
httpsProxy.authenticationDesc: Credentials for the proxy server, if required.
httpsProxy.noProxyDesc: A comma-separated list of hosts to bypass the proxy.
httpsProxy.ignoreSslDesc: Allow self-signed or unverified certificates. This may be required for some proxies but reduces security. Only enable if you trust your proxy.
httpsProxy.proxySslDesc: Validate the SSL certificate when connecting to the proxy.
httpsProxy.proxyHostSslDesc: Validate the SSL certificate of the proxy's host.
httpsProxy.peerSslDesc: Validate the SSL certificates of peer connections.
httpsProxy.hostSslDesc: Validate the SSL certificates of destination hosts.

localApiServer.title: Local API Server
localApiServer.serverLogsDesc: View detailed logs of the local API server.
localApiServer.serverPortDesc: Port number for the API server.
localApiServer.apiKeyDesc: Authenticate requests with an API key.
localApiServer.trustedHostsDesc: Hosts allowed to access the server, separated by commas.
localApiServer.corsDesc: Allow cross-origin requests to the API server.
localApiServer.verboseLogsDesc: Enable detailed server logs for debugging.

privacy.helpUsImproveDesc: To help us improve Jan, you can share anonymous data like feature usage and user counts. We never collect your chats or personal information.
privacy.privacyPolicy: You have full control over your data. Learn more in our Privacy Policy.
privacy.analyticsDesc: To improve Jan, we need to understand how it's used—but only with your help. You can change this setting anytime.
privacy.privacyPromises: Your choice here won't change our core privacy promises:
privacy.promise1: Your conversations stay private and on your device
privacy.promise2: We never collect your personal information or chat content
privacy.promise3: All data sharing is anonymous and aggregated
privacy.promise4: You can opt out anytime without losing functionality
privacy.promise5: We're transparent about what we collect and why

general.failedToRelocateDataFolderDesc: Failed to relocate data folder. Please try again.

changeDataFolder.title: Change Data Folder Location
changeDataFolder.description: Are you sure you want to change the data folder location? This will move all your data to the new location and restart the application.
changeDataFolder.warning: MOBIUS and Jan share the same data folder — together they are a pair of hands, the left and right hemispheres of the brain. Changing this location will separate your assistants, duplicate data unnecessarily, and will not prevent MOBIUS from interacting with Jan.
